title: Ex-Pakistan PM Imran Khan's wife Bushra Bibi gets bail in graft case
UK court gives mixed ruling in Pfizer vs Moderna COVID vaccine patents case
content: London's High Court invalidated one of Moderna's COVID-19 vaccine technology patents, upheld another infringed by Pfizer and BioNTech's Comirnaty vaccine. Global legal battles continue as companies plan to appeal, ensuring vaccine production remains unaffected.
summary: London's High Court invalidated one of Moderna's COVID-19 vaccine technology patents, upheld another infringed by Pfizer and BioNTech's Comirnaty vaccine. Global legal battles continue as companies plan to appeal, ensuring vaccine production remains unaffected.

title: Fourth of July celebrations: Where to find the best fireworks in Los Angeles
content: As the fourth of July approaches, Los Angeles offers numerous prime locations to enjoy breathtaking fireworks. Popular spots include the Rose Bowl, Marina Del Rey, Disneyland, Hollywood Forever Cemetery, Long Beach, Huntington Beach, Universal Studios, and Hollywood Bowl. Each venue features unique celebrations, from soccer games and movie festivals to beach activities and patriotic-themed events, promising a spectacular Independence day experience.
summary: As the fourth of July approaches, Los Angeles offers numerous prime locations to enjoy breathtaking fireworks. Popular spots include the Rose Bowl, Marina Del Rey, Disneyland, Hollywood Forever Cemetery, Long Beach, Huntington Beach, Universal Studios, and Hollywood Bowl. Each venue features unique celebrations, from soccer games and movie festivals to beach activities and patriotic-themed events, promising a spectacular Independence day experience.

title: Wickremesinghe responds to critics on Sri Lanka's debt restructuring deal
content: Sri Lankan President Wickremesinghe addresses criticism of debt restructuring, emphasizing transparency and parliamentary scrutiny. Details include debt total, interest rates, and sustainable debt focus. The plan aims to resume projects, secure foreign loans, and address short-term credit assistance. Opposition leader Premadasa questions the government's approach to debt restructuring.
summary: Sri Lankan President Wickremesinghe addresses criticism of debt restructuring, emphasizing transparency and parliamentary scrutiny. Details include debt total, interest rates, and sustainable debt focus. The plan aims to resume projects, secure foreign loans, and address short-term credit assistance. Opposition leader Premadasa questions the government's approach to debt restructuring.

title: At UN meeting, Taliban asked to include women into public life
New Zealand to press ahead with media content pay law
content: New Zealand's proposed bill to compel digital platforms to pay media for news faces opposition from the ACT New Zealand party, needing support from other parties to pass. The Labour party is expected to support the bill, aligning with the intent to help local media companies earn revenue.
summary: New Zealand's proposed bill to compel digital platforms to pay media for news faces opposition from the ACT New Zealand party, needing support from other parties to pass. The Labour party is expected to support the bill, aligning with the intent to help local media companies earn revenue.

title: Indian-American physician pleads guilty to $2.4 million healthcare fraud scheme
content: Indian American physician Mona Ghosh pleaded guilty to federal healthcare fraud for billing Medicaid and private insurers for non-existent services through her clinic, Progressive Women's Healthcare. Facing up to ten years per count in federal prison, Ghosh admitted responsibility for over $1.5 million in fraudulent reimbursements. Sentencing is scheduled for October 22, with prosecutors alleging she orchestrated a scheme involving false claims and overstated medical services from 2018 to 2022.
summary: Indian American physician Mona Ghosh pleaded guilty to federal healthcare fraud for billing Medicaid and private insurers for non-existent services through her clinic, Progressive Women's Healthcare. Facing up to ten years per count in federal prison, Ghosh admitted responsibility for over $1.5 million in fraudulent reimbursements. Sentencing is scheduled for October 22, with prosecutors alleging she orchestrated a scheme involving false claims and overstated medical services from 2018 to 2022.

title: Indigenous ritual practiced for 12,000 years, study shows
content: For more than 10,000 years, people in a part of Australia practiced the same healing ritual. A new study has shown the ability of oral traditions to keep such practices alive across hundreds of generations. The discovery sheds light on the cultural practices of the Gunaikurnai people, and their healing rituals written down in the 19th century.
summary: For more than 10,000 years, people in a part of Australia practiced the same healing ritual. A new study has shown the ability of oral traditions to keep such practices alive across hundreds of generations. The discovery sheds light on the cultural practices of the Gunaikurnai people, and their healing rituals written down in the 19th century.

title: Hurricane Beryl, a Category 4 storm, pummels Caribbean islands, eyes Jamaica
content: Hurricane Beryl ripped off doors, windows and roofs in homes across the southeastern Caribbean on Monday after making landfall on the island of Carriacou as the earliest storm of Category 4 strength to form in the Atlantic, fueled by record warm waters. Beryl strengthened from a tropical depression to a major hurricane in just 42 hours — a feat accomplished only six other times in Atlantic hurricane history.
summary: Hurricane Beryl ripped off doors, windows and roofs in homes across the southeastern Caribbean on Monday after making landfall on the island of Carriacou as the earliest storm of Category 4 strength to form in the Atlantic, fueled by record warm waters. Beryl strengthened from a tropical depression to a major hurricane in just 42 hours — a feat accomplished only six other times in Atlantic hurricane history.

title: Jamie Foxx breaks silence on mysterious illness: 'I saw the tunnel'
content: Jamie Foxx's resilience and gratitude shine through as he navigates challenges, embracing life with renewed determination post-health scare. From 'In Living Color' to fatherhood, his journey underscores the preciousness of every moment, inspiring others to cherish life's opportunities with unwavering commitment and gratitude.
summary: Jamie Foxx's resilience and gratitude shine through as he navigates challenges, embracing life with renewed determination post-health scare. From 'In Living Color' to fatherhood, his journey underscores the preciousness of every moment, inspiring others to cherish life's opportunities with unwavering commitment and gratitude.

title: Why did the US judge call Karen Read’s cop boyfriend murder 'mistrial'?
content: Karen Read's murder trial ended in a mistrial after jurors deadlocked. The retrial will proceed, with prosecutors accusing Read of second-degree murder, manslaughter, and fleeing the scene. The case involves allegations of hitting her boyfriend with an SUV and a focus on police procedures during the investigation.
summary: Karen Read's murder trial ended in a mistrial after jurors deadlocked. The retrial will proceed, with prosecutors accusing Read of second-degree murder, manslaughter, and fleeing the scene. The case involves allegations of hitting her boyfriend with an SUV and a focus on police procedures during the investigation.

title: Australian firms given six months to develop code to prevent children from seeing porn
content: Australia has given the internet industry six months to create an enforceable code to protect children from online pornography and other harmful content or face government-imposed regulations. The eSafety Commissioner demands a plan by October 3, covering age verification, parental controls, and content filtering. Google and Meta pledged cooperation, while representatives from X and Apple have yet to comment.
summary: Australia has given the internet industry six months to create an enforceable code to protect children from online pornography and other harmful content or face government-imposed regulations. The eSafety Commissioner demands a plan by October 3, covering age verification, parental controls, and content filtering. Google and Meta pledged cooperation, while representatives from X and Apple have yet to comment.

title: 'Big win for constitution': Former US President Donald Trump hails Supreme Court's 'immunity' ruling
North Korea says its recent missile tests involved new ballistic missile with 'super-large warhead'
content: North Korea tested a new ballistic missile capable of carrying a warhead. These missile tests, including the Hwasongpho-11Da-4.5, signal readiness to counter US threats. The country has intensified weapon trials since 2022, targeting key nations and leveraging an expanded nuclear arsenal for future diplomacy. Monday's missile test was North Korea's first weapons firing in five days. Last Wednesday, North Korea launched what it called a multiwarhead missile in the first known test of a developmental weapon aimed at penetrating its rivals' missile defenses.
summary: North Korea tested a new ballistic missile capable of carrying a warhead. These missile tests, including the Hwasongpho-11Da-4.5, signal readiness to counter US threats. The country has intensified weapon trials since 2022, targeting key nations and leveraging an expanded nuclear arsenal for future diplomacy. Monday's missile test was North Korea's first weapons firing in five days. Last Wednesday, North Korea launched what it called a multiwarhead missile in the first known test of a developmental weapon aimed at penetrating its rivals' missile defenses.

title: Hurricane Beryl razes southeast Caribbean as a record-breaking category 4 storm
content: Hurricane Beryl, the earliest Category 4 storm in the Atlantic, hit the southeastern Caribbean, causing severe damage but no immediate deaths. Winds reached 150 mph, affecting islands from St. Lucia to Grenada. Beryl is now moving toward Jamaica and Mexico's Yucatan peninsula. The storm's rapid intensification is attributed to record-warm waters, with officials warning of potential further damage.
summary: Hurricane Beryl, the earliest Category 4 storm in the Atlantic, hit the southeastern Caribbean, causing severe damage but no immediate deaths. Winds reached 150 mph, affecting islands from St. Lucia to Grenada. Beryl is now moving toward Jamaica and Mexico's Yucatan peninsula. The storm's rapid intensification is attributed to record-warm waters, with officials warning of potential further damage.

title: Ahead of the election, Venezuela's Maduro says he has 'agreed' to resume negotiations with the United States
content: Venezuela's President Nicolas Maduro will resume negotiations with the US to lift economic sanctions ahead of a crucial presidential election. Facing his toughest challenge in decades, Maduro seeks a third term amidst a divided and diminished support base. Opposition candidate Edmundo Gonzalez Urrutia presents a significant threat to Maduro's re-election prospects.
summary: Venezuela's President Nicolas Maduro will resume negotiations with the US to lift economic sanctions ahead of a crucial presidential election. Facing his toughest challenge in decades, Maduro seeks a third term amidst a divided and diminished support base. Opposition candidate Edmundo Gonzalez Urrutia presents a significant threat to Maduro's re-election prospects.

title: Trump seeks to set aside New York hush money verdict hours after Supreme Court ruling
content: In prior court filings, Trump contended he is immune from prosecution for conduct alleged to involve official acts during his tenure in office. His lawyers did not raise that as a defense in the hush money case, but they argued that some evidence - including Trump's social media posts about former lawyer Michael Cohen - comes from his time as president and should have been excluded from the trial because of immunity protections.
summary: In prior court filings, Trump contended he is immune from prosecution for conduct alleged to involve official acts during his tenure in office. His lawyers did not raise that as a defense in the hush money case, but they argued that some evidence - including Trump's social media posts about former lawyer Michael Cohen - comes from his time as president and should have been excluded from the trial because of immunity protections.

title: Hawk Tuah girl offered $600 to spit in a jar: 'That's just disgusting'
content: Hawk Tuah girl Hailey Welch, in her first interview after her video went viral, said she does not want to be known as the Hawk Tuah girl. Now she has a team and a management and she thinks it was just a funny act and her parents too thought the same. Going forward, she would not want this to be her image and is planning to do shows and podcasts.
summary: Hawk Tuah girl Hailey Welch, in her first interview after her video went viral, said she does not want to be known as the Hawk Tuah girl. Now she has a team and a management and she thinks it was just a funny act and her parents too thought the same. Going forward, she would not want this to be her image and is planning to do shows and podcasts.

title: Melania Trump spotted outside Trump Tower, first time after skipping debate
content: ​All eyes are on Melania Trump as she is nowhere to be seen at Trump's campaign. She also missed the presidential debate. This was not the scene in 2016 and 2020. Reports claim Melania has made a deal with Trump that if he wins the presidency, she will not be the 24X7 first lady, She will be in the White House only on occasions -- and the rest of the time she will spend with their son Barron Trump who may join New York University in the fall.
summary: ​All eyes are on Melania Trump as she is nowhere to be seen at Trump's campaign. She also missed the presidential debate. This was not the scene in 2016 and 2020. Reports claim Melania has made a deal with Trump that if he wins the presidency, she will not be the 24X7 first lady, She will be in the White House only on occasions -- and the rest of the time she will spend with their son Barron Trump who may join New York University in the fall.

title: This Indian-American ex-billionaire frauded Google, Goldman; gets 7.5-year sentence
content: 38-year-old Rishi Shah co-founded Outcome Health , a startup that provided advertisement on TVs in doctors' offices. His investors included Goldman Sachs Group, Goggle parent Alphabet etc making him a billionaire in Chicago, but it was all a fraud as the company sold more ads that it could broadcast and lied to clients like pharmaceutical giant Novo Nordisk A/S about the size of its network of TV in doctors' offices, Bloomberg reported.
summary: 38-year-old Rishi Shah co-founded Outcome Health , a startup that provided advertisement on TVs in doctors' offices. His investors included Goldman Sachs Group, Goggle parent Alphabet etc making him a billionaire in Chicago, but it was all a fraud as the company sold more ads that it could broadcast and lied to clients like pharmaceutical giant Novo Nordisk A/S about the size of its network of TV in doctors' offices, Bloomberg reported.
